items.title: An Ode to Joyful, Self-consciously Naïve Design
items.abstract: The guilelessness of childlike art: Picasso’s joyful ceramic visages; Warhol’s unaffected early drawings; vibrant fashion and furniture that appeal to one’s playful side.

items.title: City Unveils Campaign to Improve Girls’ Self-Esteem
items.abstract: New York City officials and experts in adolescent health said it was the first campaign aimed at female body image that they knew of to be carried out by a major city.

items.title: Review: ‘Chronically Metropolitan,’ and Hopelessly Self-Indulgent
items.abstract: The movie, featuring high-income characters in low-stakes situations, finds a writer returning home to Manhattan to win back a lost love.

items.title: IBM Opens Chip Architecture, in Strategy of Sharing and Self-Interest
items.abstract: The first server designs resulting from IBM’s decision to open up its Power chip technology are being announced on Wednesday.

items.title: Silicon Valley Dominating Self-Driving Tech? Motor City Says Not So Fast
items.abstract: Silicon Valley, with Google and Tesla, is developing the smart cars of tomorrow, but the Detroit Three are working hard on self-driving projects in Michigan.
